articles.content:
Book "Long Strides Towards Reunification" published in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Book "Long Strides Towards Reunification" was published by the South Korean People's Rights Institute of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration on June 15 on the occasion of the second anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, according to a news report. 
 The book consists of five chapters.    
 The book deals with victory of the reunification movement of the Korean nation to terminate the division of the country, the U.S. policy to stifle and isolate the north and victory of the strategy for independent reunification, the historic significance of the June 15 joint declaration and the vigorous advance of the fellow countrymen for the implementation of the joint declaration. It calls for smashing the U.S. attempt to obstruct the implementation of the joint declaration and ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and the undisguised war moves of the U.S. imperialists through the anti-U.S., anti-war and anti-nuclear campaign and opening a decisive phase of national reunification.

June 15 joint declaration favored 
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Different political parties and a social organization of Italy recently participated in the international signature campaign supporting the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and demanding the immediate withdrawal of the U.S. troops from South Korea.
 The signature papers were separately signed by the representatives of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy, the People's United Democratic Left-Wing of Italy, the central organizational Committee for Founding the Communist Party and the Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Cooperation.

Paek Nam Sun meets S. African ambassador 
     Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a talk with Themba Kubheka, new South African ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him today.
